intro: Lepanthopsis ornipteridion, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive orange lip, which are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
